title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

entries.title: D-Day anniversary haunted by dwindling number of veterans and shadowed by Europe's new war
entries.description: World War II veterans and new leaders gathered at Normandy to honor the dead and the fight for democracy on the 80th D-Day anniversary, overshadowed by the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Two British judges quit Hong Kong's top court
entries.description: Two British judges resigned from Hong Kong's top court following a subversion trial of 14 democratic activists amid a national security crackdown in the financial hub.

entries.title: A 102-year-old World War II veteran dies en route to D-Day commemorations
entries.description: World War II Navy veteran Robert Persichitti, 102, died en route to France for the 80th D-Day anniversary. His friend, Rev. William Leone, shared his excitement for the trip. Persichitti passed away in Germany listening to Frank Sinatra. He served...

entries.title: Panama community pushed from Caribbean island by rising sea levels moves into new houses
entries.description: Indigenous Guna families from Gardi Sugdub were relocated to Isberyala due to rising sea levels. The new community offers cooler temperatures and government-constructed houses. Some families chose to stay on the low-lying island despite climate...

entries.title: Watch: Sunita Williams dances after returning from Starliner mission
entries.description: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams and her crewmate Butch Wilmore piloted the Boeing Starliner, marking a historic milestone with Williams becoming the first woman to pilot and test a new crewed spacecraft on its maiden voyage.

entries.title: Heat wave sweeps through Southwest US: Arizona, California, and Nevada on alert
entries.description: Record-breaking heat wave hits US Southwest, with temperatures exceeding 110 degrees Fahrenheit. Campaign rally for Donald Trump in Phoenix sees 11 people hospitalized for heat exhaustion. Clark County Fire Department responds to multiple heat...

entries.title: Hunter Biden told lover he was a ‘drunk and an addict’
entries.description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, admitted to his former lover, Hallie Biden, that he was a drug and alcohol addict. Texts revealed that within hours of purchasing a gun, he was buying and using crack cocaine. This revelation came during...

entries.title: Nato stands with Ukraine like US backed Europe against Nazis: Biden
entries.description: US President Joe Biden marked the 80th anniversary of D-Day on the beaches of Normandy on Thursday. He emphasized that the allied effort to resist Russia's invasion of Ukraine is a continuation of the fight for freedom that spread across Europe...

entries.title: Dozens killed as Israel hits UN school shelter in Gaza
entries.description: On Thursday, Israel launched an air strike targeting a school in Gaza. The strike was aimed at up to 30 Hamas fighters reportedly inside the building. A Hamas official stated that 40 individuals, including women and children, were killed while...

entries.title: ‘Smoked crack every 20 min’: US prez son’s drug-fuelled past laid bare in court
entries.description: Hunter Biden's ex-wife and a former girlfriend testified on Wednesday in his gun trial, revealing their discoveries of his crack pipes and other drug paraphernalia. Jurors were shown photos of President Biden's son, bare-chested in a bubble bath,...

entries.title: Court pauses Georgia poll inteference case
Spain applies to join South Africa’s genocide ICJ case
NYPD moves to revoke Trump’s licence to carry a gun
entries.description: The New York Police Department is attempting to revoke former President Donald Trump's concealed carry license following his conviction in the New York hush-money case. According to sources familiar with the situation, Trump had a concealed-carry...

entries.title: Boeing capsule docks with ISS despite glitches
Bibi warns of ‘intense op’ against Hezbollah
Putin issues dire warning to countries aiding Ukraine
Rio Grande: After 34 million years, scientists discover Antarctica's lost river
Israel accused of using white phosphorus in Lebanon
entries.description: Accusations have emerged of Israel using white phosphorus munitions in southern Lebanon amid escalating tensions with Hezbollah, prompting international concern and calls for intervention.

entries.title: 'Outrage as tourist spots 'secret' behind China’s famous waterfall'
entries.description: China's Yuntai Park faces scrutiny over artificial maintenance of its famous waterfall, sparking debate on authenticity of natural attractions.

entries.title: Prince Harry withdraws from high-society wedding
entries.description: Prince Harry pulls out of high-profile wedding of Jordanian Crown Prince Hussein and Rajwa Al Saif, citing potential challenges and unwanted attention.
